column4: is it possible that the geometries are "hard coded" in gnome-terminal?
if I use the flag geometry, it doesnt work
you need to use gconf-editor to set the terminal geometry
what's the item that do I need to change?
adjust exec to gnome-terminal --geometry=90x40 (or whatever you desire)
then create it, see the following URL http://ubuntuforums.org/archive/index.php/t-255048.html
logout and log back in, i believe i rebooted as well to be sure
just re-read the post and checked my config.  it's in /desktop/gnome/applications/terminal, I think i forgot to include the applications part :$
what's the name of key that you added?
where do I need to put it? (global/keybindings/profiles)
from the root directory of gconf-editor, do you see the key /apps/desktop/gnome/applications/terminal??
